Michael Dillon }} '''The Shooters''' was a five-piece [[country music]] band founded in [[Muscle Shoals, Alabama]]. It consisted of [[Walt Aldridge]] (lead vocals, guitar), [[Gary Baker (songwriter)|Gary Baker]] (bass guitar), Barry Billings (guitar), Chalmers Davis (keyboards), and Michael Dillon ([drums). They charted several times on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' country charts between 1986 and 1989.{{cite web |url= http://www.oldies.com/artist-biography/The-Shooters.html |title=The Shooters biography |accessdate=2008-09-30 |work=Oldies.com}} The quintet's first four singles were to have been included on an album titled ''Going Against the Wind''.{{cite news|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=KrwcAAAAIBAJ&sjid=QnAEAAAAIBAJ&pg=2644,2645023&dq=the-shooters+going-against-the-wind&hl=en|title=Drummer is upbeat about The Shooters|last=Handelman|first=Jay|date=2 May 1987|work=Sarasota Herald-Tribune|accessdate=10 August 2011}} 1989's ''Solid as a Rock'' included their highest-charting single, the number 13 "Borderline".{{cite book|last=Whitburn|first=Joel|title=Hot Country Songs 1944 to 2008|publisher=Record Research, Inc|date=2008|page=380|isbn=978-0-89820-177-2}} After disbanding, Aldridge worked as a songwriter and record producer, while Baker joined songwriting partner [[Frank J. Myers]] to write [[John Michael Montgomery]]'s 1994 hit single "[[I Swear]]", which was later covered by [[All-4-One]] as well. Baker and Myers also recorded one album as the duo [[Baker & Myers]].
